result.execSummary:
The defendant Carmen Nmi Ciezki was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
8 days credit only if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

No consumption/possession of alcohol.

No entry into bars/taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions the same as count 2 with no additional community service to be performed.
Concurrent with: Count 2

records.addlTxt: Defendant's response to state's demand for discovery

Defendant Carmen Nmi Ciezki in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:04 PM. Called 16CM137 and 16CM138. State - resolved - 16CM137 - amend #2 to county ordinance of DC with $300 fine plus costs, dismiss count #1, have complied with victim notification requirements with no response or request for restitution; on 16CM138 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with $300.00 fine plus costs, plead to counts #2 and #3 as alleged, withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety and no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bar or tavern, employment/school, 100 hours of community service. Cirilli and Ciezki agree. Court - 16CM137 - court dismisses count #1 and amends count #2 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - 60 DTP/CO. Court - 16CM138 - court amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs totalling $582.50 - take bond posted - remainder due in 90 days/CO. Ciezki pleads NC to counts #2 and #3 as alleged on 16CM138. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, find the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation - asks about expunction. Cirilli - follow joint recommendation. Ciezki withholds statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 18 months - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service (total), costs on each count - paid thru probation, pay court appointed attorney fees - paid as originally ordered until receipt of bill (10 days), 8 days credit only if revoked, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on October 19, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Carmen Nmi Ciezki in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:33 AM. Cirilli and Ciezki have complaints, waives reading on both complaints, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on both matters, sets both matters for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Carmen Nmi Ciezki in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CM137 and 16CM138. Called 10:08 AM. Ciezki has complaints for both cases. Court advises of charges, penalties and right to an attorney. Ciezki understands charges and penalties and would like an attorney. Court refers to contact SPD and court appointed attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 09:30 am.
